greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of partitions of n with k parts in which no part occurs more than twice; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=A055086(n), read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..400, flattened
maple: T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n$2)):
mathematica: max = 15; g = -1+Product[1+t*x^j+t^2*x^(2j), {j, 1, max}]; t[n_, k_] := SeriesCoefficient[g, {x, 0, n}, {t, 0, k}]; t[0, 0] = 1; Table[Table[t[n, k], {k, 0, n}] /. {a__, 0 ..} -> {a}, {n, 0, max}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 08 2014 *)
xref: Cf. A002620, A008289 (no part more than once), A055086, A117147 (no part more than 3 times).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 19 2013
